activity_b.text: Thilina works in the Mechanical Workshop at the institute in Kandy.
He starts work at eight every morning, but today he is starting earlier because a new engine has arrived for testing.
Everyone is excited because it is a new model, with the latest technology, so they all want to see it being tested.
He usually begins his day by checking the lubricant levels, but this morning he is setting up the air compressor because the instructor is demonstrating how to operate pneumatic tools.
He normally uses his own socket wrench set, but today he is borrowing tools from the tool room because his kit is missing a few parts.
He always wears safety goggles, but now he is wearing an extra face shield because he is grinding metal components.
Most days, Thilina repairs gear systems and cleans filters, but this week he is assembling a small diesel pump for a customer project.
He usually checks the machinery with the instructor, but today he is inspecting the generator because it is making a strange noise.
He normally discusses the work with his colleagues, but now he is listening carefully because the instructor is explaining how to check the carburetor.
At the end of the day, he always wipes the workbench, but this afternoon he is greasing the lathe machine because it has been a bit stiff to use.
He likes his work because he learns something new every day, and he is becoming more confident with every task he does.
